availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Matilda Goss Reasor on May 1, 1861. Father of William T. Reasor and Catharine L. Reasor. Member of the City Council of Louisville from the 2nd Ward in 1859. Confirmed as a notary public in Jefferson County on February 5, 1861. Attorney in Louisville in 1860 and 1861. City Attorney of Louisville from 1861 to 1866.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 2, p. 383.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7007126, Louisville Deaths, p. 291.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1783-1965, KDLA, Roll #unknown, Jefferson County Marriages, p. 99.
Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1859 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1859), 308.
Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 307.
Annual Communication of the Mayor, and Reports of Departments, of the City of Louisville, (Louisville: Bradley & Gilbert, 1867), p. 1.
KYR-0001-017-0062.
